Usage notes
subSections.text:
In speech, this toneless particle is found in complementary distribution with several other particles, governed by the nature of the preceding syllable. However, this distinction is not strictly reflected in writing, and {{lang|zh|啊}} tends to an all-encompassing particle. Thus it may carry the pronunciation of any of its variants below in actual speech:

* ''-ng, ci, zi, si, chi, zhi, shi'' + [a] → {{lang|zh|啊}} [a]
* ''-a, -o, -e, -i, -ü'' + [a] → {{zh-l|*呀}} [ya]
* ''-u, -ao'' + [a] → {{zh-l|*哇}} [wa]
* ''-n'' + [a] → {{zh-l|*哪}} [na]

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
'''{{lang|vi|啊}}'''

# {{n-g|Used in the beginning of a sentence to indicate questioning.}} [[ah]], [[oh]], [[ha]]
#: {{lang|vi|'''啊'''[[困]][[碎]]！}} ({{lang|vi|A khốn tôi !}} '''Ha'''! I'm so unlucky !
